channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2025050007
item.description:
Report E-2025050007

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1719 had a crack and released approximately one (1) gallon to the dock floor. R+L Carriers remediated the dock floor, then retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to perform a tote transfer. The crew transferred the tote and broke down the damaged tote for containerization in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040640
item.description:
Report E-2025040640

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A truck was parked over the weekend at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Baytown, TX. Upon unloading the truck the following week it was discovered that one of the drums had reacted, causing the drum to fail and approximately 4oz of material to be leaked into the cargo portion of the truck. The spill was remediated and the drum was overpacked into a 851H2 along with the spill cleanup materials.

item.title: Report E-2025040563
item.description:
Report E-2025040563

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When our driver started unloading product was pouring out of the QRB assembly. he shut down but by the time pressure came off the line there was 10 gallons that spilled, 3 of which went in to the catch bucket and 7 on the ground. When they pulled it back to the operating center and inspected it with safety representatives they found that the external valve quick release bonnet had been disassembled incorrectly.

item.title: Report E-2025040562
item.description:
Report E-2025040562

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-24
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 24, 2025, eight (8) 1-gallon pails of UN3266 were crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) cup of product to the cardboard containers. R + L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report E-2025040557

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 23, 2025, two (2) 1-gallon pails of pint were crushed and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety & Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040553
item.description:
Report E-2025040553

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: HARLINGEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0848 ET, XPO-LHG notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 2 teaspoons of slow reducer released from a metal pail due to improper packaging (manufacturing defect). The release impacted just the pail itself. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. 231921-1 10-gallon metal drum- pail, shrink-wrap.

item.title: Report E-2025040374
item.description:
Report E-2025040374

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-16
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KENAN ADVANTAGE GROUP HOLDINGS CORP.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4050
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the delivery hose and the pump became compromised. This allowed approximately 12 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Lone Star Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
